title.narrative: Strengthening Assistance to Returnees, IDPs and Mobile Populations in Afghanistan Through the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM)

description.narrative: The overall goal of this project is to contribute to the social cohesion and stabilisation of Afghan communities affected by displacement, return and chronic poverty. The project will use an evidence-based approach, through Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM), to identify locations with high concentrations of returnee, internally displaced and migrant populations. In order to establish a complete national evidence base to inform and strengthen policies, programming and selection of priority areas of intervention for humanitarian, reintegration and development partners, the proposed project aims to expand and enhance DTM’s existing evidence base by implementing settlement-level Baseline Mobility Assessments and Community-based Needs Assessments in thirteen previously unassessed provinces to capture locations, population sizes, mobility trends and multi-sectoral needs of returnees, IDPs, migrants and host communities. The DTM information will enable IOM and its partners to understand the mobility patterns and needs of IDPs, returnees, migrants and host communities, strengthening their ability to deliver mobility-sensitive, better-targeted, sustainable humanitarian assistance, reintegration, and community stabilisation programming.
